episodes.title: Inside Goenka Vipassana: Is it a cult?
episodes.description:
Why do people ask if Goenka Vipassana is a cult?

This video examines Goenka-style Vipassana 10 day courses meditation through the lens of high-control systems, using established psychological and sociological frameworks — including Steven Hassan’s BITE Model and research on isolation, repetition, and suggestibility.

This is not an attack on meditation, and it is not a claim about intent.
Many people report Vipassana as grounding, meaningful, and beneficial.

At the same time, others report distress, confusion, or psychological difficulty — particularly in highly controlled retreat environments involving silence, isolation, and exhaustion.

Rather than arguing over labels, this documentary asks simpler questions:

How is the environment structured?

How is behavior, information, and interpretation shaped?

Why does the “cult question” keep coming up — quietly, repeatedly — among participants?

The analysis focuses on structure and impact, not belief, and draws directly from:

the official Vipassana Code of Discipline

peer-reviewed research on sensory restriction and influence

first-person reports and documented concerns

Sources & References

Primary Materials

Code of Discipline for Vipassana Courses
(Source: Official Vipassana / Dhamma.org website — publicly available retreat guidelines)

Psychological & Sociological Frameworks

Hassan, S. (2000). Combating Cult Mind Control

Lifton, R. J. (1989). Thought Reform and the Psychology of Totalism

Research on Isolation & Suggestibility

Zubek, J. P. (1969). Sensory Deprivation: Fifteen Years of Research

Willoughby, W. L. (2007). Effects of Sensory Deprivation and Isolation on Cognition and Behavior

Important Mental Health Note

Intensive meditation practices can sometimes trigger unexpected psychological distress, especially in silent, high-intensity retreat settings.

If you or someone you know is experiencing difficulty related to meditation practice, confidential, evidence-based support is available:

👉 https://www.cheetahhouse.org

Cheetah House provides education, resources, and support for people navigating adverse or destabilizing experiences related to meditation.

Seeking help is not a failure — it’s responsible.

episodes.title: Inside Goenka Vipassana: The Experience That Broke Me
episodes.description:
I attended a 10-day Goenka Vipassana meditaiton retreat, expecting peace and insight - but what I experienced was intense and unsettling, and far from what most people imagine. In this personal story and expose, I reveal the hidden dangers of Goenka Vipassana, the psychological challenges I faced, and the truth behind the serene exterior.

This video covers: 

-My firsthand terrifying experience at a 10-day Vipassana retreat.
-The hidden dangers and psychological intensity of Goenka meditation.
-Reflections on what Vipassana meditation doesn't tell you
-The dangers of meditation, that nobody talks about.
-We look at the teachings of Goenka and question whether they are universal and secular or religious.

If you're curious about Goenka's Vipassana, meditation retreats, or the psychological risks of intensive meditation, this video gives an honest, personal perspective.
